intro: Dichoropetalum seseloides, commonly known as the slender sesel, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
